author: Daniel Kruger
title: U.S. Dollar Rises on Positive Outlook
text:
The U.S. dollar advanced Wednesday as economic data continued to point to solid U.S. growth, even as the pace of expansion in Europe appears to be slowing.
The WSJ Dollar Index, which measures the currency against a basket of 16 others, rose for a third consecutive session, climbing 0.3% to 86.35â€”its highest close since Dec. 27. The index is now up 0.4% for the year. The dollar rose 0.4% against the euro to $1.195.
